item.title: Overcoming Weakness the Smart Way
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_1528" align="alignright" width="300" caption="fPat on Flickr"][/caption]

Yesterday, I undertook the fourth installment of the CrossFit Sectionals Open Workouts. It looked right up my alley, involving two movements I am very good at - burpees and muscle ups - and only one that I wasn't - heavy overhead squat (really, I'm not good at much that is heavy).

Nevertheless, I was confident I would do well. All I had to do was suffer through the squats in order to get to one of my strengths. Unfortunately, I found the squats too much, and I didn't even manage to finish them before the timer buzzed.

I felt defeated. Even with the advantage of having my strengths, I was stopped by one thing that I'm weak at.
